repnme.cdata!: China - Iodine Deficiency Disorders Control Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outstanding assessments show highly
            satisfactory ratings on project outcome, and sustainability,
            substantial institutional development impacts, and
            satisfactory performances by the Bank, and Borrower. Lessons
            suggest that the ultimate success of the project was due to
            three positive factors in the greater environment of the
            country: strong political support; strong alignment of the
            interests of economic development, and industrial
            modernization; and, prior sector analysis, and strategy
            development at the national, and international levels.
            However, and regardless of success, negative lessons can be
            drawn about a certain lack of realism in three items, agreed
            upon during project negotiations: a) the difficult
            relationship, and dialogue with the Ministry of Health,
            seemingly suggests that strong funding support could have
            facilitated access, and, that access across sectors
            reinforces the interdependence of key sectors to achieve
            objectives; b) the short implementation period, highlighting
            the constructive aspect of project extensions, which often
            compensates unforeseen factors that come into play during
            implementation; and, c) the unnecessarily onerous conditions
            of effectiveness, could have been arranged through a more
            phased approach, avoiding irritant situations of managerial concern.
